intro: Hybanthus nigricans, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are often mistaken for edible fruits, though they are toxic. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and a distinctive bilabiate structure. Hybanthus nigricans is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
